verses.verse: A Psalm of David. <WH1732> Plead <WH7378> my cause, O LORD, <WH3068> with them that strive <WH3401> with me: fight <WH3898> against them that fight <WH3898> against me.
Take <WH2388> hold <WH2388> of shield <WH4043> and buckler, <WH6793> and stand <WH6965> up for my help. <WH5833>
Draw <WH7324> out also the spear, <WH2595> and stop <WH5462> the way against <WH7125> them that persecute <WH7291> me: say <WH559> to my soul, <WH5315> I am your salvation. <WH3444>

Let them be confounded <WH954> and put to shame <WH3637> that seek <WH1245> after my soul: <WH5315> let them be turned <WH5472> back <WH268> and brought <WH2659> to confusion <WH2659> that devise <WH2803> my hurt. <WH7451>
Let them be as chaff <WH4671> before <WH6440> the wind: <WH7307> and let the angel <WH4397> of the LORD <WH3068> chase <WH1760> them.
Let their way <WH1870> be dark <WH2822> and slippery: <WH2519> and let the angel <WH4397> of the LORD <WH3068> persecute <WH7291> them.
For without <WH2600> cause <WH2600> have they hid <WH2934> for me their net <WH7568> in a pit, <WH7845> which without <WH2600> cause <WH2600> they have dig <WH2658> for my soul. <WH5315>
Let destruction <WH7722> come <WH935> on him at unawares; <WH3045> and let his net <WH7568> that he has hid <WH2934> catch <WH3920> himself: into that very destruction <WH7722> let him fall. <WH5307>
And my soul <WH5315> shall be joyful <WH1523> in the LORD: <WH3068> it shall rejoice <WH7797> in his salvation. <WH3444>

All <WH3605> my bones <WH6106> shall say, <WH559> LORD, <WH3068> who <WH4310> is like <WH3644> to you, which deliver <WH5337> the poor <WH6041> from him that is too strong <WH2389> for him, yes, the poor <WH6041> and the needy <WH34> from him that spoils <WH1497> him?
False <WH2555> witnesses <WH5707> did rise <WH6965> up; they laid to my charge <WH7592> things that I knew <WH3045> not.
They rewarded <WH7999> me evil <WH7451> for good <WH2896> to the spoiling <WH7908> of my soul. <WH5315>

But as for me, when they were sick, <WH2470> my clothing <WH3830> was sackcloth: <WH8242> I humbled <WH6031> my soul <WH5315> with fasting; <WH6685> and my prayer <WH8605> returned <WH7725> into <WH5921> my own bosom. <WH2436>
I behaved <WH1980> myself as though he had been my friend <WH7453> or brother: <WH251> I bowed <WH7817> down <WH7817> heavily, <WH6957> as one that mourns <WH57> for his mother. <WH517>

But in my adversity <WH6761> they rejoiced, <WH8055> and gathered <WH622> themselves together: yes, the attackers <WH5222> gathered <WH622> themselves together against <WH5921> me, and I knew <WH3045> it not; they did tear <WH7167> me, and ceased <WH1826> not:
With hypocritical <WH2611> mockers <WH3934> in feasts, <WH4580> they gnashed <WH2786> on me with their teeth. <WH8127>
Lord, <WH136> how <WH4100> long <WH5704> will you look <WH7200> on? rescue <WH7725> my soul <WH5315> from their destructions, <WH7722> my darling <WH3173> from the lions. <WH3715>
I will give you thanks <WH3034> in the great <WH7227> congregation: <WH6951> I will praise <WH1984> you among much <WH7227> people. <WH5971>
Let not them that are my enemies <WH341> wrongfully <WH8267> rejoice <WH8055> over me: neither let them wink <WH7169> with the eye <WH5869> that hate <WH8130> me without <WH2600> a cause. <WH2600>
For they speak <WH1696> not peace: <WH7965> but they devise <WH2803> deceitful <WH4820> matters <WH1697> against <WH5921> them that are quiet <WH7282> in the land. <WH776>
Yes, they opened their mouth <WH6310> wide <WH7337> against <WH5921> me, and said, <WH559> Aha, <WH253> aha, <WH253> our eye <WH5869> has seen <WH7200> it.
This <WH2088> you have seen, <WH7200> O LORD: <WH3068> keep not silence: <WH2790> O Lord, <WH3068> be not far <WH7368> from me.
Stir <WH5782> up yourself, and awake <WH6974> to my judgment, <WH4941> even to my cause, <WH7379> my God <WH430> and my Lord. <WH136>
Judge <WH8199> me, O LORD <WH3068> my God, <WH430> according to your righteousness; <WH6664> and let them not rejoice <WH8055> over me.
Let them not say <WH559> in their hearts, <WH3820> Ah, <WH253> so would <WH5315> we have it: let them not say, <WH559> We have swallowed <WH1104> him up.

Let them be ashamed <WH954> and brought <WH2659> to confusion <WH2659> together <WH3162> that rejoice <WH8055> at my hurt: <WH7451> let them be clothed <WH3847> with shame <WH1322> and dishonor <WH3639> that magnify <WH1431> themselves against <WH5921> me.

Let them shout <WH7442> for joy, and be glad, <WH8056> that favor <WH2655> my righteous <WH6664> cause: yes, let them say <WH559> continually, <WH8548> Let the LORD <WH3068> be magnified, <WH1431> which has pleasure <WH2655> in the prosperity <WH7965> of his servant. <WH5650>
And my tongue <WH3956> shall speak <WH1897> of your righteousness <WH6664> and of your praise <WH8416> all <WH3605> the day <WH3117> long.
